study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the neuroprotective effects of pelargonidin on cerebral ischemia/reperfusion injury in a rat model of middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO).
results_summary: Pelargonidin reduced cerebral ischemia volume, improved neurological function, and enhanced memory and learning ability in MCAO rats. It also modulated inflammatory and oxidative stress markers by promoting the Nrf2/HO-1 signaling pathway.
population_specificity: Male or female rats with induced middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the chronic effects of pelargonidin (PG) on hippocampal neurons and memory processes in a rat model of Alzheimer's disease (AD).
results_summary: PG treatment reduced neuronal apoptosis and improved cognition and memory deficits in AD rats, as evidenced by behavioral tests and TUNEL assay. PG also increased the discrimination index in the novel object recognition test but did not affect behavioral variables in non-AD rats.
population_specificity: Male adult rats with induced Alzheimer's disease (AD model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the interaction mechanism of pelargonidin (PG) with tyrosinase and assess its potential as an inhibitor for melanin-related diseases.
results_summary: PG exhibited strong inhibitory activity on tyrosinase (IC50 = 41.94 × 10⁻⁶ mol·L⁻¹) via mixed-mode inhibition, causing conformational changes in the enzyme through hydrogen bonds and van der Waals forces. The study suggests PG could be a candidate drug for melanin-related conditions.
population_specificity: In vitro (enzyme interaction study, no human or animal subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-obesity potential of pelargonidin by examining its effects on adipogenesis inhibition in 3T3-L1 cells.
results_summary: Pelargonidin significantly reduced cellular oil droplet content, triglyceride accumulation, and glucose consumption in 3T3-L1 cells. It also suppressed PPAR-γ expression and its target proteins, indicating anti-adipogenic activity via the PPAR-γ signaling pathway.
population_specificity: 3T3-L1 cells (a mouse pre-adipocyte cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pelargonidin 3-glucoside (P3G) could alleviate symptoms of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and metabolic syndrome in rats.
results_summary: P3G reversed IBD symptoms (diarrhea, mucosal damage, inflammation) and improved metabolic syndrome markers (blood pressure, cardiac/liver structure, obesity).
population_specificity: Rats with induced chronic IBD or metabolic syndrome.
study_duration: 6 weeks for IBD rats, 8 weeks for metabolic syndrome rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the hyperglycemia-lowering effects of Pelargonidin-3-glucoside (Pg3G) and its underlying mechanisms in type 2 diabetes, focusing on autophagy and gut microbiota modulation.
results_summary: Pg3G promoted glucose uptake in hepatocytes and improved glucose tolerance and insulin sensitivity in diabetic mice by inducing autophagy and modulating gut microbiota composition, including increasing Prevotella abundance and the Bacteroidetes/Firmicutes ratio.
population_specificity: High-glucose/high-fat-induced hepatocytes and db/db diabetic mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective capability of pelargonidin-loaded nanoparticles (NPG) against cypermethrin-induced toxicity in fish and L6 muscle cells.
results_summary: NPG demonstrated protective effects in fish muscle cells by improving cell viability, reducing DNA damage, and modulating stress-related enzymes. In L6 cells, NPG reduced ROS generation and nuclear condensation while altering stress-related protein signaling.
population_specificity: Oreochromis mossambica (fish model) and L6 muscle cell line.
study_duration: Not specified (measurements taken from 6 h to 24 h post-administration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Pelargonidin (PEL) could modulate renal functional damage in a mouse model of sepsis and elucidate the underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: PEL treatment reduced renal damage in mice by lowering serum creatinine, BUN, and oxidative stress markers, while enhancing antioxidant defenses and reducing inflammatory cytokines. It also inhibited NF-κB activation and nitric oxide synthase induction, improving survival in CLP-induced sepsis.
population_specificity: Mice with CLP-induced sepsis and renal injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Pelargonidin (PEL) could effectively treat LPS-mediated vascular inflammatory responses by assessing its anti-inflammatory activities.
results_summary: PEL inhibited LPS-induced barrier disruption, reduced expression of cell adhesion molecules, and suppressed neutrophil adhesion and migration in endothelial cells and mice. It also decreased production of pro-inflammatory cytokines (TNF-α, IL-6) and inhibited NF-κB and ERK1/2 activation, suggesting potential therapeutic benefits for vascular inflammatory diseases.
population_specificity: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) and mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate pelargonidin's effect on cellular transformation in mouse skin epidermal JB6 P+ cells induced by TPA and explore its potential anti-cancer mechanisms.
results_summary: Pelargonidin significantly reduced colony formation and suppressed cell viability in JB6 P+ cells, activated the Nrf2-ARE signaling pathway, and decreased DNA methylation in the Nrf2 promoter region, enhancing expression of protective genes like NQO1 and HO-1.
population_specificity: Mouse skin epidermal JB6 P+ cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticancer effects of pelargonidin on the U2OS osteosarcoma cell line, focusing on mechanisms like autophagy, ROS induction, and cell cycle arrest.
results_summary: Pelargonidin showed significant anticancer effects with an IC50 of 15 μM, inducing autophagy, reducing mitochondrial membrane potential, triggering G2/M cell cycle arrest, and inhibiting p-PI3K and p-AKT expression.
population_specificity: U2OS osteosarcoma cell line (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effects and mechanism of Pelargonidin (PG) in counteracting osteoarthritis (OA) progression in mice and chondrocytes.
results_summary: PG reduced inflammatory markers (IL-6, TNF-α, COX-2, iNOS) and ECM catabolism in chondrocytes, inhibited NF-κB pathway activation, and improved cartilage morphology and markers (Collagen II, Aggrecan) in OA mice.
population_specificity: C57BL/6 mice and primary chondrocytes from newborn mice.
effective_dosage: In vitro: 10 μM, 20 μM, 40 μM; in vivo: dosage not specified.
study_duration: In vitro: 24-72 hours; in vivo: 8 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory effects of Pelargonidin-3-O-glucoside (P3G) from strawberries in experimental models, both in vivo and in vitro.
results_summary: The study found that strawberry extract and P3G exhibited significant anti-inflammatory properties, including reduced leukocyte migration, exudation levels, and inflammatory mediators. P3G's mechanism involved inhibiting IkB-α activation and reducing JNKMAPK phosphorylation.
population_specificity: Experimental models (in vivo and in vitro, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanism of pelargonidin's action on cell cycle regulators (CDK1, CDK4, CDK6) and DNA methylation-related epigenetic signals (DNMT1, DNMT3A).
results_summary: Pelargonidin showed strong cytotoxicity toward cancer cells, specifically inhibiting CDK1 activation and blocking the G2-M transition of the cell cycle. It also induced apoptosis via cytochrome c release and potentially inhibited DNA methylation by interfering with DNMT1 and DNMT3A binding.
population_specificity: HT29 cancer cell lines (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the extraction of Pelargonidin from Ficus benghalensis and assess its phenotypic effects, particularly anti-angiogenic potential, in zebra fish embryos.
results_summary: Pelargonidin caused significant aortic development reduction and phenotypic abnormalities (bent tail, malformed eyes, vasculature delays) in zebra fish embryos at 3.3-20 ppm. The study suggests Pelargonidin has anti-angiogenic potential for treating neovascular diseases and tumors.
population_specificity: Zebra fish embryos (0-72 hpf)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Pelargonidin (PEL) could modulate TGFBIp-mediated inflammatory responses in human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) and mice, and assess its potential as a therapy for vascular inflammatory diseases.
results_summary: PEL inhibited TGFBIp-induced barrier disruption, reduced expression of cell adhesion molecules, and suppressed neutrophil adhesion and migration in HUVECs. It also decreased hyperpermeability and leukocyte migration in mice, suggesting anti-inflammatory properties beneficial for vascular inflammatory diseases.
population_specificity: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) and mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to study the effect of ultrasound on the stability and antioxidant capacity of pelargonidin-3-glucoside (Pg-3-glu) and the correlation between anthocyanin degradation and •OH generation.
results_summary: Ultrasound treatment degraded Pg-3-glu, with degradation following first-order reaction kinetics and correlating with •OH production. Antioxidant activity of Pg-3-glu solutions decreased after ultrasound exposure, as measured by DPPH and FRAP assays.
population_specificity: Simulated system (not human or animal subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Pelargonidin (PEL) could modulate HMGB1-mediated inflammatory responses in human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) and mice, and its potential therapeutic effects on sepsis.
results_summary: PEL effectively inhibited LPS-induced HMGB1 release, suppressed HMGB1-mediated septic responses (hyperpermeability, leukocyte adhesion/migration), and reduced pro-inflammatory cytokine production (TNF-α, IL-6) and signaling pathways (NF-κB, ERK1/2). It also improved survival rates in a mouse sepsis model.
population_specificity: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) and mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether nanoencapsulated pelargonidin (NPG) is more effective than free pelargonidin (PG) in preventing alloxan-induced oxidative stress and DNA damage in L6 cells.
results_summary: Both PG and NPG reduced alloxan-induced oxidative stress and activated DNA repair mechanisms, with NPG showing approximately 10-fold greater efficacy than PG in preventing DNA damage.
population_specificity: L6 cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether chronic pelargonidin (PG) treatment could alleviate hyperalgesia in streptozotocin-induced diabetic neuropathic rats.
results_summary: PG treatment, especially multiple doses, significantly reduced hyperalgesia in diabetic rats and decreased oxidative stress markers, suggesting it may prevent diabetic neuropathic hyperalgesia through oxidative stress attenuation.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats with streptozotocin-induced diabetes.
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg orally, once and/or on alternate days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to verify Pelargonidin's antidiabetic potential, particularly its role in counteracting oxidative stress linked to glycated hemoglobin in diabetes.
results_summary: Pelargonidin normalized blood glucose, improved insulin levels, restored antioxidant enzyme activity, and reduced oxidative stress markers in diabetic rats. It also inhibited hemoglobin glycation and iron-mediated oxidative damage.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats (streptozotocin-induced diabetic and normal controls)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pelargonidin (Pel) could attenuate behavioral and structural abnormalities and reduce oxidative stress markers in a rat model of Parkinson's disease (PD).
results_summary: Pelargonidin administration dose-dependently reduced rotational behavior, protected neurons from 6-OHDA toxicity, and decreased oxidative stress markers like TBARS and nitrite levels, though its effect on SOD was non-significant. The findings suggest Pel has neuroprotective effects partly through mitigating oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Unilateral intrastriatal 6-OHDA-lesioned rats (experimental model of PD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antidiabetic effects of a pelargonidin derivative with glibenclamide in moderately diabetic rats.
results_summary: The pelargonidin derivative reduced fasting blood glucose by 19% in a single dose and improved glucose tolerance by 29%. Long-term treatment (one month) further decreased fasting blood glucose levels by nearly half and improved glucose tolerance by 15%.
population_specificity: Moderately diabetic rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine and compare the effect of topical peppermint gel versus cold compresses on reducing pain caused by needle insertion in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Peppermint gel significantly reduced pain compared to the control group, with no statistically significant difference in efficacy compared to cold compresses. Both interventions were more effective than the standard method.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis (HD) patients
effective_dosage: Peppermint gel applied 20 minutes before needle insertion
study_duration: Single application (20 minutes before needle insertion)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of peppermint extract on postharvest ripening, physiological activities, and aroma components in 'Packham's Triumph' European pear fruit.
results_summary: Peppermint extract delayed fruit softening by 4 days and reduced ethylene and respiratory rate peaks but did not delay the respiratory climacteric peak or significantly increase peppermint aroma. Metabolome analysis revealed significant changes in flavonoids and lipid compounds, with enrichment in specific metabolic pathways.
population_specificity: 'Packham's Triumph' European pear fruit

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inhaling peppermint oil could reduce pain and anxiety levels in patients after lumbar discectomy surgery.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil inhalation significantly reduced pain and anxiety levels in patients after the third and fourth postoperative hours, though no significant difference was observed at the second hour.
population_specificity: 68 patients (34 experimental, 34 control) who underwent lumbar discectomy surgery.
effective_dosage: Five drops of peppermint oil inhaled for 10 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to confirm the efficacy and safety of peppermint oil (ZO-Y60) in Japanese patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil significantly improved IBS symptoms, with high improvement rates in patient and physician assessments (71.6% in week 2 and 85.1% in week 4). Adverse events were mild and non-serious, occurring in 20.3% of subjects.
population_specificity: Japanese outpatients aged 17-60 years diagnosed with IBS according to the Rome III criteria.
effective_dosage: Oral capsule of ZO-Y60 three times a day before meals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether aromatherapy with peppermint essential oil could reduce gag reflexes during oral stimulation in dental procedures.
results_summary: The study found that aromatherapy with peppermint essential oil significantly increased gag reflex tolerance compared to baseline, with effects comparable to nitrous oxide/oxygen inhalation. However, the placebo (distilled water) also showed a significant but lesser increase in gag reflex tolerance.
population_specificity: 24 healthy individuals (12 females and 12 males; mean age: 34.3 ± 9.5 years).
study_duration: Single session per intervention (aromatherapy, placebo, and positive control).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory potential of peppermint and its main component, menthol, by reviewing existing literature.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint may suppress inflammation through multiple pathways, including downregulating pro-inflammatory mediators and oxidative stress, and inducing anti-inflammatory prostaglandins. However, the lack of human studies suggests the need for further clinical trials.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of novel Z-R/H nanoparticles as stabilizers for peppermint oil Pickering emulsions, focusing on physical stability, antioxidant activity, and aroma retention.
results_summary: The study found that Z-R/H3:1-stabilized Pickering emulsions exhibited excellent physical stability, high peppermint oil retention (72.1% after 4 weeks), and additive antioxidant effects against DPPH and ABTS free radicals. The emulsion also effectively prevented volatilization of peppermint oil aroma components.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anthelmintic effects of peppermint essential oil against Dactylogyrus sp. infections in carp.
results_summary: Peppermint essential oil showed weak antiparasitic efficacy (28.23%) against Dactylogyrus sp., with cumulative mortality reaching 100% at 1 μl/ml concentration in approximately 15 minutes in vitro. It was the least effective among the tested oils.
population_specificity: Carp (Cyprinus carpio) infected with Dactylogyrus sp.
effective_dosage: 1, 2.5, 5, and 10 μl/ml concentrations tested in vitro; EC50 concentration used in vivo.
study_duration: Single bath application in vivo; exposure durations varied (15 min for 100% mortality in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of aromatherapy massage with peppermint essential oil on menopausal symptoms in women.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint essential oil significantly reduced menopausal symptoms, particularly somatic and urogenital symptoms, and was more effective than lemon essential oil. Psychological symptoms were not significantly improved by peppermint oil.
population_specificity: 63 menopausal and postmenopausal women.
effective_dosage: 1.5% peppermint essential oil diluted in sweet almond oil, applied twice weekly in 30-minute sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anthelmintic efficacy and safety of peppermint essential oil for controlling gastrointestinal nematodes in sheep.
results_summary: Peppermint essential oil showed ovicidal activity (21.0-90.3%) in vitro and reduced nematode egg counts by 26.9-46.0% in vivo, with no observed toxic effects on sheep. The oil's main compounds included menthol, menthone, and menthyl-acetate.
population_specificity: Sheep with gastrointestinal nematode infections.
effective_dosage: 150 mg/kg (in vivo), concentrations ranging from 0.0125 to 50 mg/mL (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the transdermal permeation properties of peppermint oil (PO)-mediated S-glycerosomes and their impact on stratum corneum lipids.
results_summary: The study found that PO-S-glycerosomes enhanced transdermal flux, penetrated deeper into the skin, and altered stratum corneum lipid composition, particularly ceramides. PO-S-glycerosomes improved the treatment efficacy of xylene-induced inflammation in mice without skin irritation.
population_specificity: Mice (xylene-induced inflammation model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of inhaled peppermint essence on pain relief and sleep quality in patients after open-heart surgery.
results_summary: The study found that inhaled peppermint essence significantly reduced pain severity and improved sleep quality compared to the placebo group, with statistically significant differences observed on both days post-intervention.
population_specificity: 64 cardiac patients who underwent open-heart surgery in Iran.
effective_dosage: Not specified (inhaled aromatherapy with peppermint essence).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inhalation aromatherapy with peppermint and lemon essential oils could effectively manage chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting and improve quality of life in children.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint-lemon aromatherapy significantly reduced pulse and respiratory rates, improved quality of life, and decreased nausea-vomiting symptoms compared to placebo and control groups. The effects were most notable by the 4th chemotherapy cycle.
population_specificity: 2-12-year-old children undergoing chemotherapy.
study_duration: Duration of chemotherapy cycles (specific length not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of methyl jasmonate (MeJa) on essential oil content, composition, and total phenolic content in peppermint.
results_summary: MeJa treatment increased volatile content by 9-35% in most trials, altered essential oil composition (e.g., increased menthone, decreased pulegone and menthofuran), and generally elevated total phenolic content.
population_specificity: Peppermint plants grown in climatic chambers and open fields.
effective_dosage: 2 mM MeJa sprayed twice on aerial parts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibiofilm and bactericidal properties of peppermint oil against key foodborne and food spoilage pathogens on various food contact surfaces.
results_summary: Peppermint oil significantly reduced biofilm formation (2.5-log to 5-log reduction) and demonstrated high bactericidal activity, with Vibrio parahaemolyticus showing the highest sensitivity. Microscopic analysis revealed degradation of biofilm structures and cell membrane damage.
population_specificity: Bacterial pathogens (Vibrio parahaemolyticus, Listeria monocytogenes, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Escherichia coli O157:H7, Salmonella Typhimurium) on food contact surfaces (stainless steel, rubber, high-density polyethylene, polyethylene terephthalate).
effective_dosage: 1/2× MIC, MIC, and 2× MIC (specific concentrations not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of peppermint for common cold symptom management based on Ayurvedic texts, Jamu publications, and international monographs.
results_summary: The study reviewed existing literature and expert opinions but did not provide specific findings on peppermint's efficacy or safety for common cold symptoms. It highlighted the cultural use of herbal medicines like peppermint but noted gaps in healthcare provider knowledge and patient communication.
population_specificity: Not specified (general common cold sufferers inferred)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inhalation of peppermint essential oil could improve exercise performance and reduce oxidative damage in rats subjected to endurance training.
results_summary: Inhalation of peppermint essential oil significantly extended exhaustion time in rats undergoing weight-bearing swimming training and reduced oxidative damage. However, rats not subjected to training did not show improved performance.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of peppermint extract and probiotics on biochemical blood factors in chickens with induced ascites syndrome.
results_summary: Peppermint extract significantly improved weight gain and reduced cholesterol, triglyceride, uric acid, glucose, and liver enzyme levels in chickens with induced ascites, demonstrating its effectiveness in improving the condition.
population_specificity: Male broiler chickens (21 days old) with induced ascites syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of peppermint oil on gastrointestinal motility, sensitivity, and its potential applications in treating functional gastrointestinal disorders (FGIDs) like irritable bowel syndrome and functional dyspepsia.
results_summary: Peppermint oil demonstrated smooth muscle relaxant and anti-spasmodic effects on various parts of the gastrointestinal tract, improved endoscopic performance, and modulated visceral and central nervous system sensitivity, suggesting its efficacy for FGIDs. It also showed a favorable safety profile compared to conventional pharmacological treatments.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on functional gastrointestinal disorders).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the hormetic effects of cadmium (Cd) exposure on peppermint and identify the underlying mechanisms, particularly focusing on antioxidant activity and phenylpropanoid biosynthesis pathways.
results_summary: Low-level Cd exposure (1.6 mg L-1) induced a hormetic effect in peppermint, enhancing antioxidant activity and phenylpropanoid biosynthesis, while high-level exposure (6.5 mg L-1) caused temporary antioxidant responses insufficient to counteract Cd toxicity. Transcriptome analysis confirmed these findings, showing consistent gene expression patterns aligned with physiological changes.
population_specificity: Peppermint young plants
effective_dosage: 1.6 mg L-1 (low) and 6.5 mg L-1 (high) Cd exposure

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the physiological and biochemical impacts of five insecticides on peppermint, focusing on secondary metabolic pathways and potential alterations in quality and therapeutic value.
results_summary: Insecticide treatments led to significant reductions in soluble protein and phenylpropanoid metabolites, while increasing phytohormones and lignin levels, suggesting altered defense mechanisms and potential quality degradation in peppermint. Pyriproxyfen caused the most pronounced changes in physiological and metabolic indexes.
population_specificity: Peppermint plants (Mentha × piperita L.)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Menthacarin (a combination of peppermint oil and caraway oil) in treating functional gastrointestinal disorders, including functional dyspepsia (FD) and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The meta-analysis of randomized trials demonstrated significant pain reduction and general improvement in FD patients compared to placebo, with favorable results also noted in IBS and FD patients with Helicobacter pylori infection. Menthacarin was found to be effective and safe for these conditions.
population_specificity: Patients with functional dyspepsia (FD), irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), and FD with Helicobacter pylori infection, including individuals aged 12 years and older.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of green manures, organic manures, and biofertilizers on nutrient content, dry matter yield, essential oil productivity, and quality in peppermint.
results_summary: The 50%HV + 50%B green manure treatment was most effective, yielding the highest nutrient content, plant growth, dry yield, and essential oil content (1.8%) and yield (4.84 g m-2). The essential oil composition was primarily menthol, menthone, and 1,8-cineole, with the highest menthol and 1,8-cineole content observed in the 50%HV + 50%B treatment and the highest menthone in the AMF treatment.
population_specificity: Peppermint plants (no human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review advances in the extraction, biological activities, pharmacological effects, toxicity, and applications of peppermint essential oil (PEO), with a focus on its efficacy for burn wounds and psoriasis.
results_summary: The study found that PEO exhibits anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, antiviral, and antioxidant activities, with potential benefits for gastrointestinal, liver, kidney, skin, respiratory, brain, and nervous systems. It also highlighted PEO's clinical use for gastrointestinal and dermatological diseases, as well as postoperative adjuvant therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to update a previous meta-analysis to assess the efficacy and safety of peppermint oil in treating irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), particularly in light of recent studies questioning its role.
results_summary: Peppermint oil was more effective than placebo for improving global IBS symptoms and abdominal pain, but adverse events were significantly more frequent with its use. The quality of evidence was rated as very low, indicating a need for further high-quality studies.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) (1030 participants across 10 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether peppermint drops could improve bowel function recovery after cesarean section compared to a placebo.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint drops significantly reduced the time to first intestinal sounds, first gas passing, and first defecation compared to placebo, with no reported nausea or vomiting in either group.
population_specificity: 102 women who underwent cesarean section.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to measure the binding efficiency of β-cyclodextrin-peppermint oil (β-CD_PM) to cellulose in cotton and cotton/polyester fabrics using ultrasonic treatment and assess its antimicrobial effects.
results_summary: The study found that ultrasonic treatment modified the physico-chemical properties of the cellulosic material and demonstrated partial antimicrobial efficacy against Gram-negative bacteria in treated fabrics.
population_specificity: Cotton and cotton/polyester fabrics treated with β-CD_PM.
study_duration: 10 min sonication followed by 24 h bath immersion

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the phytochemical content, in vitro radical scavenging activity, and in vivo oxidative stress reduction potential of peppermint ethanolic extract (PEE).
results_summary: PEE showed significant in vitro radical scavenging activity (IC50 = 126.695 µg/mL) and effectively reduced oxidative stress in vivo, with 5 mg/200 g BW being the most effective dose (malondialdehyde level dropped to 0.312 nmol/mL).
population_specificity: Male Sprague-Dawley rats (n=25, divided into five groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether aromatherapy with peppermint essential oil could reduce fatigue in cardiac patients compared to lavender essential oil and a placebo.
results_summary: The study found that both peppermint and lavender essential oils significantly reduced fatigue in cardiac patients compared to the control group, with no statistically significant difference between the two essential oils.
population_specificity: 105 cardiac patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the cost-effectiveness of small-intestinal release peppermint oil versus placebo in treating IBS patients.
results_summary: Peppermint oil was found to be a cost-effective treatment for IBS, with a 56% probability of being cost-effective at a conservative willingness-to-pay threshold of €10,000/QALY. It also showed a high probability (89%) of being cost-effective when using abdominal pain responder as the outcome measure.
population_specificity: Patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to standardize breath sampling and analysis by evaluating the washout profiles of peppermint oil volatiles in exhaled breath after ingestion.
results_summary: The study found significant variability in the washout profiles of peppermint volatiles across individuals and analytical platforms, suggesting biological variability plays a key role. Benchmark washout values were established for key compounds like limonene, menthol, and menthofuran.
population_specificity: 65 individuals (no further demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of enteric-coated peppermint oil versus placebo in relieving IBS symptoms in individuals with moderate to severe IBS.
results_summary: Both peppermint oil and placebo groups showed substantial improvements in IBS symptoms, but there were no statistically significant differences between the groups. The effect size was small, and sensitivity analyses confirmed no significant differences on any outcome measure.
population_specificity: Individuals diagnosed with IBS (Rome IV criteria) and moderate to severe symptoms (IBS-SSS score ≥175).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of combined lemon and peppermint aromatherapy on nausea and vomiting in pregnant women.
results_summary: The study found that combined lemon and peppermint aromatherapy significantly reduced mild to moderate nausea and vomiting intensity on the second, third, and fourth days of intervention compared to placebo. The effect of time on symptom reduction was significant in the aromatherapy group but not in the placebo group.
population_specificity: 90 pregnant women suffering from nausea and vomiting in Birjand, Iran.
effective_dosage: Three drops of combined lemon and peppermint essential oils on a cotton ball, inhaled at a 3-cm distance from the nose.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the use of peppermint oil (PmO) in organo-hydrogels as a drug release system for paracetamol and carboplatin.
results_summary: Increasing peppermint oil in organo-hydrogels to 0.3 mL enhanced drug release, with maximum release rates of 72.3% for paracetamol and 99.7-100% for carboplatin at pH 7.4. The organo-hydrogels demonstrated blood compatibility and antioxidant properties.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a standardized method for analyzing breath samples to determine the presence and concentration of peppermint oil compounds after ingestion.
results_summary: The study successfully developed a rapid and accurate technique for detecting peppermint oil compounds in breath, with detection limits as low as 1 pptv. Analyte concentrations were unaffected by sampling mode but slightly influenced by respiratory and exhalation flow rates.
population_specificity: Nominally healthy volunteer

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of peppermint oil on nausea, vomiting, and retching severity in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: Peppermint oil significantly reduced the frequency of nausea, vomiting, and retching, as well as the severity of nausea, in patients receiving various chemotherapy regimens, except for cisplatin.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy in an ambulatory unit.
effective_dosage: One drop applied between the upper lip and nose, three times daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of peppermint essential oil on Fusobacterium nucleatum growth, biofilm formation, killing, and volatile sulfur compound production, as well as its biocompatibility with oral keratinocytes.
results_summary: Peppermint essential oil showed antibacterial activity against F. nucleatum, reduced biofilm viability, and dose-dependently decreased volatile sulfur compound production. It was also biocompatible with oral keratinocytes at effective concentrations.
population_specificity: In vitro study using F. nucleatum bacteria and oral keratinocytes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of peppermint extract on the severity of nausea, vomiting, and anorexia in breast cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint extract significantly reduced the severity of nausea, vomiting, and anorexia at 24 and 48 hours post-chemotherapy compared to the control group. The experimental group showed lower mean scores for these symptoms, with statistical significance (P < .05).
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy (n = 84, split into experimental and control groups).
effective_dosage: 40 drops of peppermint extract mixed in 20 cc of tap water every 8 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in patients receiving peppermint aromatherapy versus standard care alone.
results_summary: The study found no statistical significance in PONV reduction (P = .28), but peppermint aromatherapy was preferred by many patients and associated with decreased nausea complaints.
population_specificity: Postoperative patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether peppermint essential oil inhalation reduces postoperative nausea and vomiting in cardiac surgery patients.
results_summary: Peppermint essential oil inhalation significantly reduced the frequency, duration, and severity of nausea, as well as the frequency of vomiting episodes in the first four hours after extubation compared to the control group.
population_specificity: 60 cardiac surgery patients, predominantly those who underwent coronary artery bypass graft surgery.
effective_dosage: Not specified (nebulizer aromatherapy before endotracheal tube removal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inhaled peppermint essential oil (aromatherapy) is effective for relieving nausea and vomiting (N/V) in hospitalized patients, either alone or combined with antiemetics.
results_summary: Peppermint essential oil significantly improved nausea scores in hospitalized patients, with greater improvement observed in the aromatherapy-only group compared to the combined aromatherapy/antiemetic group. Most patients (65%) chose peppermint oil alone, and patient perception of its effectiveness improved significantly.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients experiencing nausea and vomiting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify volatile compounds in breath after ingestion of a peppermint oil capsule to benchmark SESI-HRMS for breath analysis.
results_summary: The study detected 57 additional volatile compounds associated with peppermint oil ingestion, suggesting a more complex metabolic response than expected, and identified a core of 35-40 consistently detected molecules.
population_specificity: Two subjects (specific demographics not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of spark plasma in decontaminating peppermint distillate while assessing its impact on physicochemical properties.
results_summary: Spark plasma achieved a 4-log reduction in Pseudomonas aeruginosa counts after 4 minutes of treatment, with minimal changes in acidity and color but a 17% reduction in menthol content.
population_specificity: Microbial contamination in peppermint distillate.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of peppermint aromatherapy on anxiety in patients with acute coronary syndrome in the emergency department.
results_summary: Peppermint essential oil inhalation significantly reduced anxiety in the intervention group compared to the control group, with a statistically significant decrease in anxiety scores post-intervention. No significant change was observed in the control group.
population_specificity: Patients with acute coronary syndrome in the emergency department (n=64).
effective_dosage: Cotton ball soaked in 100% peppermint essential oil placed 20 cm from the patient's nose.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of different doses of peppermint oil (PMO) on gut microbiome composition in children with functional abdominal pain.
results_summary: PMO administration did not significantly alter overall gut microbiome diversity or composition but impacted low-abundance bacteria, particularly Collinsella. The 540 mg dose differentially affected the Firmicutes/Bacteroidetes ratio compared to lower doses.
population_specificity: Thirty children aged 7-12 years with functional abdominal pain.
effective_dosage: 180 mg once daily, 180 mg twice daily, or 180 mg thrice daily (total daily doses: 180 mg, 360 mg, 540 mg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish a standardized protocol for measuring volatile organic compounds (VOCs) in breath after peppermint oil ingestion and determine appropriate sampling time points for washout analysis.
results_summary: The study identified the washout profile of peppermint compounds in breath, formalized data analysis methods, and proposed benchmark values for VOC measurement. It successfully recruited participants and collected samples using multiple analytical techniques.
population_specificity: 15 participants (5 in initial phase, 10 in follow-up)
effective_dosage: Peppermint oil capsule (specific dosage not mentioned)
study_duration: Samples collected up to 10 hours post-ingestion

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of peppermint powder as a feed additive on growth performance, immune parameters, and gene expression in Caspian roach.
results_summary: Peppermint supplementation significantly improved growth parameters, reduced food conversion ratio, enhanced hematological indices, and boosted immune responses, including increased enzyme activity and gene expression of IGF, GH, and HSP70. The highest effects were observed at 4 g/kg peppermint.
population_specificity: Caspian roach (Rutilus caspicus) fingerlings (average weight 2.40 ± 0.12 g).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of peppermint and lavender aromatherapy on sleep quality in cancer patients.
results_summary: Peppermint aromatherapy significantly improved sleep quality in cancer patients compared to the control group, as measured by the PSQI. The effect was comparable to lavender aromatherapy.
population_specificity: Cancer patients with sleep disorders
effective_dosage: Three drops of peppermint essential oil (frequency not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of peppermint essential oil, alone and in combination with tomato pomace extract, on the quality and safety of cooked pork sausages with reduced sodium nitrite.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint essential oil (PM) reduced total plate count (TPC) in sausages, and its combination with tomato pomace extract (TP) lowered residual nitrite content and lipid oxidation (TBARS value). PM also contributed to enhanced sausage quality when used with reduced sodium nitrite.
population_specificity: Cooked pork sausages (in vitro food model).
study_duration: Not specified (likely short-term, during sausage processing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of the peppermint peel (PMP) medical device in treating various signs of skin aging, including discoloration, fine wrinkles, and hydration issues.
results_summary: The study found that PMP was effective and safe, with no adverse events reported—only minimal flaking and slight redness. The therapeutic failure rate was 0%, and the best results were seen in women aged 38-57.
population_specificity: 121 subjects with signs of chrono and photo aging.
effective_dosage: A session every 2 weeks for a total of 4 sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of peppermint oil in providing symptomatic relief for diffuse esophageal spasm (DES).
results_summary: The study reported that an elderly female patient experienced symptomatic relief from DES after using peppermint oil, suggesting its potential efficacy in this context. However, the evidence is limited to a single case.
population_specificity: Elderly female patient with diffuse esophageal spasm (DES).
